sub_title: Connecting islands of expertise to tackle critical research questions with impact
summary: I believe that while we focus on producing high-quality scientific content, we should pay just as much attention to the scientific process. As a research project manager, I facilitate scientists in their collaborations, so that they can avoid reinventing the wheel and achieve synergies with impactful results. I enjoy collaborating with experts from diverse disciplines to answer complex questions methodically & creatively. I lead research consortia and provide support to researchers so that they feel a sense of belonging in achieving common goals for the good of the society and environment.

'Institute of Biology Leiden (IBL)', 'description': 'Studied how noise pollution from offshore human activities affects fish behaviour

Data analytics
•	Designed 6 experiments that produced clean data suitable for robust statistical models
•	Managed & analysed 5TB worth of datasets including spatial, environmental & behavioural data, as well as video & audio recordings
•	Conducted acoustic analyses using MATLAB & advanced statistics using Excel, SPSS & R 

Communication/presentation
•	Synthesised new findings & existing knowledge into compelling narratives to drive regulatory changes
•	Presented research findings at least once a month to different audiences, including fellow scientists, policy makers, stakeholders & the general public
•	Delivered engaging lectures & seminars to students 
•	Won the best student presentation award at the 15th European Congress of Ichthyology 2015

Writing proficiency
•	Produced research proposals & reports regularly, published PhD thesis as a book, 5 articles/abstracts in conference proceedings & 7 scientific papers in high-impact journals
•	Assisted the preparation of 2 grant proposals

Project management
•	Outlined short- & long-term plans for 4-year PhD project & finished it in time
•	Collaborated with 5 institutes, involving physicists, modellers, behaviourists, marine ecologists & aquaculturists. Carefully considered all parties’ interests while commanding the direction of the project
•	Resolved disagreements with respectful discussions
•	Coordinated field site logistics, applications of permits & purchases of equipment & materials

Leadership
•	Supervised 4 BSc/MSc student internships, 3 of which resulted in publication 
•	Guided new colleagues on their projects; provided advice & constructive feedback to colleagues regularly

Research skills
•	Developed & optimised several novel experimental setups
